sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
This action creates new Credentials on Jenkins Server.

Inputs:

  • Username - Username to be added in the credentials.
  • Password - Password for the given username.
  • Scope - Scope in which the Jenkins credentials should be created. Determines where this credential can be used. Select either of "GLOBAL" or "SYSTEM" from the drop down list.
  • Description - Description for the Credentials.
  • ID - A unique ID by which these credentials are identified from jobs and other configuration. Normally left blank, in which case an ID will be generated. Useful to specify explicitly when using credentials from scripted configuration.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is “Error”.

Error Messages:

  • Provided value for one of the inputs is invalid.
  • Unauthorized - Incorrect username and / or password.
  • The Jenkins server is being restarted.
  • Credential with given ID already exists.
  • You do not have enough permissions to perform this action in Jenkins server.

To use this action, the corresponding Jenkins connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jenkins Connection & Credential alias.

Disclaimer:Jenkins and Jenkins logo are a registered trademark of Jenkins.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
